news_header: Meta has announced Project Waterworth, a plan to build a 50,000km sub-sea cable connecting the US, India, South Africa, Brazil, and other regions, making it the world's longest underwater cable project.
news_original_title: Meta plans globe-spanning sub-sea internet cable
news_text: This initiative aims to enhance connectivity for AI projects and promote economic cooperation and digital inclusion. The cable will utilize a 24 fibre-pair system for higher capacity. As undersea cables are crucial for global internet traffic, Meta's investment reflects a trend of tech companies taking on infrastructure roles traditionally held by telecom firms. Concerns over the vulnerability of these cables to geopolitical tensions have also been raised.
